Naan with Yogurt

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking for a quick and delicious way to elevate your meals, this Naan with Yogurt recipe is the perfect choice. Naan, a soft and pillowy Indian flatbread, is not only a fantastic accompaniment to various dishes but also serves as a delightful canvas for flavorful dips and spreads. This simple yet satisfying recipe combines warm naan with a creamy yogurt dip that's enhanced with olive oil and optional garlic for an extra punch of flavor. Whether you're serving it as an appetizer, a side dish, or a snack, this combination is sure to please. Plus, with the option to sprinkle fresh herbs on top for garnish, your presentation will impress family and friends alike. Perfect for busy weeknights or casual gatherings, this Naan with Yogurt recipe is a must-try for anyone looking to indulge in a taste of Indian cuisine right at home. Let's dive into the ingredients and steps to create this delightful dish!

Ingredients

naan bread

Naan is best enjoyed warm; you can heat it on a skillet for a few minutes on each side to achieve a nice texture. If you don't have naan, you can substitute with pita bread or any flatbread. For a homemade option, consider making quick naan using plain flour, yogurt, and baking powder.

plain yogurt

Plain yogurt is versatile; you can use Greek yogurt for a thicker consistency or non-dairy yogurt if you're looking for a vegan option. To enhance the flavor, consider adding a pinch of cumin or paprika to the yogurt mix.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil provides a rich flavor, but you can substitute it with any neutral oil like canola or sunflower oil. For added taste, infuse the oil with herbs before mixing it with yogurt.

garlic (optional)

Fresh garlic adds a wonderful flavor, but if you're out, garlic powder can be used as a substitute (1/8 tsp per clove). Roasting the garlic before mincing it will give a sweeter, milder flavor.

salt

Use sea salt or kosher salt for a better flavor profile. If you're watching your sodium intake, consider using low-sodium salt or enhancing the flavor with herbs and spices instead.

fresh herbs (optional)

Fresh herbs like cilantro, parsley, or mint can elevate the dish. If you don’t have fresh herbs, dried herbs can be used, but use them sparingly as they are more concentrated in flavor.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Warm the Naan Bread

    Begin by warming the naan bread. You can do this by placing it in a pan over medium heat for about 1-2 minutes on each side, or you can microwave it for about 15-20 seconds. This will make the naan soft and pliable, perfect for dipping!

  • Step 2: Prepare the Yogurt Mixture

    In a small mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of plain yogurt with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. If you enjoy garlic, add 1 minced clove for added flavor. Sprinkle in salt to taste. Mix everything well until smooth and creamy. This will enhance the yogurt's flavor and create a delicious dip.

  • Step 3: Serve

    Once the naan is warmed and the yogurt mixture is ready, it’s time to serve! Arrange the warm naan on a plate alongside the yogurt dip. For an extra touch, you can garnish the yogurt with fresh herbs like cilantro or mint. Enjoy by dipping the naan into the yogurt or spreading it on top!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare the naan bread before serving?

You can warm the naan by placing it in a dry skillet over medium heat for about 30 seconds on each side, or by microwaving it for 10-15 seconds until soft. This enhances the texture and flavor.

What is the best way to mix ingredients for the yogurt dip?

In a small bowl, combine the plain yogurt, olive oil, and minced garlic (if using). Use a fork or whisk to blend them together until smooth. This ensures an even distribution of flavors.

How do I know how much salt to use?

Start with a pinch of salt and mix it into the yogurt. Taste it, and gradually add more if needed. Remember, you can always add more, but you can't take it out!

Can I use different herbs for garnish?

Absolutely! Fresh herbs like cilantro, parsley, or mint can add a lovely flavor and color. Chop them finely and sprinkle on top just before serving.

What if I don’t have garlic?

No worries! You can skip the garlic or substitute it with garlic powder. A little goes a long way, so start with a small amount and adjust to your taste.

Is there a safe way to use the microwave for warming naan?

Yes! Place the naan on a microwave-safe plate and cover it with a damp paper towel to keep it from drying out. Heat in short intervals of 10-15 seconds and check for softness.

How can I make this dish more filling?

You can add toppings to the naan before serving, such as grilled vegetables, cheese, or even a protein like chicken or chickpeas to make it a more substantial meal.

What are some variations I can try with the yogurt dip?

You can mix in spices like cumin or paprika, or add a squeeze of lemon juice for brightness. Experiment with flavors to find your favorite combination!

How do I store leftover naan and yogurt?

Store leftover naan in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for longer storage. Yogurt can be stored in the fridge for up to a week; just stir before serving.

What is a good way to serve this dish?

Serve the naan warm on a plate with the yogurt dip in a small bowl on the side. You can also include some fresh veggies or pickles for added flavor and crunch.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is vegetarian and can be made gluten-free by using gluten-free naan. To enhance dietary options, consider using dairy-free yogurt alternatives made from coconut or almond milk for those with lactose intolerance or following a vegan diet. You can also add nutritional yeast to the yogurt for a cheesy flavor without the dairy.

Pairings

Pair the naan with a variety of dishes such as grilled meats like tandoori chicken or lamb skewers, or vegetarian options like chickpea curry or roasted vegetables. For beverages, consider serving with a refreshing mango lassi, a light lager, or a crisp Sauvignon Blanc to complement the flavors. If you're feeling adventurous, a spicy chai tea can also enhance the experience.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the naan warm on a rustic wooden board or a colorful platter. Place the yogurt dip in a small bowl at the center, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of fresh herbs like cilantro or mint. For a visually appealing presentation, you can add some sliced cucumbers and cherry tomatoes on the side for a fresh crunch. If serving at a gathering, consider offering a variety of flavored yogurts, such as cucumber-mint or spiced yogurt, to cater to different tastes.

#

Naan with Yogurt

15 min
$5
300 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 2

Allergens:

GlutenDairy

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianLow-Calorie

Cuisine:

IndianMediterranean

Course:

SnackAppetizer

Tags:

QuickSnackEasyComfort Food

Description

Soft, fluffy naan served with creamy yogurt for a delightful snack or side.

Ingredients

  • naan bread: 2 pieces
  • plain yogurt: 1 cup
  • olive oil: 1 tablespoon
  • garlic (optional): 1 clove, minced
  • salt: to taste
  • fresh herbs (optional): for garnish
